page.title: 05LERWICK WATERWORKS
page.content: ON FRIDAY 10TH MAY,WE VISITED{THE {WATERWORKS}WHICH IS IN ONE OF OUR SQUARES.{THE WATERWORKS}WAS BUILT IN 1980 AT A COST OF{ONE AND A HALF {MILLION POUNDS.}THERE IS A RESERVOIR ABOVE THE WATERWORKS WHICH IS A FRESH WATER LOCH CALLED THE SANDY LOCH.{ONE {MILLION GALLONS}OF WATER GOES THROUGH THE WATERWORKS EVERY DAY AND FIFTY CUBIC LITRES OF WATER IS WASTED.ALUM AND LIME ARE ADDED TO THE WATER.THE ALUM BLEACHES THE WATER AND THE LIME REDUCES ACIDITY.THE WATER IS PURIFIED BY USING THREE BIG TANKS,THE FIRST TANK HAS RAW WATER,THE SECOND IS CALLED CLARIFIED WATER AND THE THIRD CALLED FINAL WATER.NO FLUORIDE IS ADDED AT THE MOMENT AS THE BILL HAS NOT YET BEEN PASSED BY PARLIAMENT.IN THE WATERWORKS THERE ARE ONLY THREE MEN EMPLOYED.
